resources.string: This Silver Crows thing might turn out to be more profitable than I thought! \n\nI'd say we're off to a pretty good start. Wouldn't you?

You ever notice people are more restless, faster-to-the-trigger in the heat? Something with the humours and tempers, they say. \n\nWe got a customer in the Brimstone desert. Not saying he's mad, but he might be a bit touched.
It's only a matter of time before the Blood of the Sands rises to their rightful place once more.
The Blood of the Sands
A new client, Malek, has asked the Silver Crows to help him search for three ancient eggs.
"Isn't everyone on this island?"

Well this one more than most. His letter reads like a manifesto. Malek's the name, claims to be part of something called the "Blood of the Sands." \n\nHere's the strange bit - he wants our help scouring the desert for some sort of giant eggs.
"Giant eggs of what?"
Devourers, he says. Could he mean something like that giant desert wurm? \n\nSounds a bit addled to me, but Malek says the eggs won't hatch, so no need to worry about them just cracking open.
"So I should I meet with Malek?"

Yeah, but he wants a rubbing of some ancient mural first. It's got clues to the eggs' location. \n\nOnce you got that, meet Malek in New Corsica. Go on, and I'll follow. And don't forget to dress for the heat.
It probably goes without saying, but I harbor no love for the desert. \n\nMuch rather have water in me boots than dry sand!

Ah, the legendary hero who leads the Silver Crows, at last we meet. \n\nI am Malek, leader of the Blood of the Sands. We have much in common, and now a shared cause as well in recovering the sacred eggs of the Devourers.
"Why do you seek these eggs?"
It is our sworn duty! From the mural, you learned the history, but not the tragic state of the Blood of the Sands. \n\nOur Order has long since lost its way, the descendants fallen Lost or gone mad.
Make a copy of the ancient mural\ninBrimstone Sands
After we decipher the rubbing, we'll restore the legacy of the Blood of the Sands. \n\nWe will resume our proud traditions, honor our covenant with the Devourers… until our sacred duty is fulfilled.
Glimpse of the Past
The new client for the Silver Crows, Malek, has asked that I take the rubbing of the Blood of the Sands Mural to his sage in New Corsica.
"So the goal is to recover and safeguard the eggs?"

Oh, our obligation extends far beyond that... But yes, that is our priority right now. \n\nI've hired a sage - Sadiki Masufa - to study the rubbing from the mural, if you would be so good as to go and see him.
"What will he do?"

He shall help us track down the eggs. Lost for centuries, at last, the hour of their restoration is at hand! \n\nOnce we have the locations, we will set out straight away. My offer is simple - for whichever eggs you retrieve, you receive a reward.
"You'll be seeking the eggs as well?"

Of course! It's our duty to the Devourers. We prepare for our journey even now. \n\nThe urgency of the task is the only reason we need mercenary assistance. Now please, get the rubbing to Sadiki, and anything else he needs.
You know what needs to be done. I see no reason for further delay.
There are more wonders buried under the sands of Brimstone than all the rest of Aeternum combined!

Ah! You must be the mercenary Malek hired to venture into the ruins! I hope you didn’t encounter too much resistance. \n\nLet's have a look at the rubbing from the mural. I hope it has the answers we seek.
"It appeared to contain some kind of map."

Excellent, yes… I can make out the basic elements, but to decipher these words, I'll need samples of the desert tongue, the original language of the Blood of the Sands. \n\nWhere might we acquire such things?
"Doesn't Malek know the language?"

No, Malek is not a blood descendant, and if any even remain, I suspect the language has been forgotten. \n\nBut their people once traded in the Great Bazaar outside the city. There may be old coins and tablets there I could use.
"I can gather those for you."
Excellent! I will attempt to decipher what I can while you venture forth. \n\nBring me whatever you find at the Bazaar. Hopefully that will help me glean whatever information remains.
Hmm. It says something here about… water? No, that can't be right…

Ah, my bold partner! I'm glad you've returned! I hope you found enough samples to help me puzzle out the rest of this. \n\nIn the meantime, I've deciphered just enough of the rubbing to yield our first clue.

It seems the cipher the Blood of the Sands used when hiding the eggs is associated with the elements. \n\nThe secret to unlocking the hiding place of the first egg lies in a key called the "Word of Water."
The Word of Water

Malek's hired sage, Sadiki Masufa, found the hiding place of the egg but it is locked behind a key called the 'Word of Water.' I'll need to find the keystone at a nearby digsite to unlock the chamber where the egg rests.
"So we need to get this key first?"

Exactly! I suspect it is a keystone, and will unlock the ceremonial chamber where the egg was hidden. \n\nI've already shared this information with Malek and presumably, he and his followers have set out to find it.
"Did he say what he wanted me to do?"

No, but you should also visit the ruins to locate the key. Malek's people are... dedicated, but they're not exactly scholars. \n\nI suspect you'll have better luck finding the Word of Water than they will.
"What do I do if I find it?"

The mural indicated that the Word of Water will direct you to the ceremonial chamber where the egg is hidden. \n\nIf you're smart, you'll recover the egg before Malek, and then collect your reward. Good luck, my friend!
I will continue to decipher the rubbing. You should seek out the Word of Water and the sacred egg associated with it.
If you're not here to help, I'd rather you be on your way. \n\nI'm hoping these bastards will forget about me long enough for me to get free.

If you're here to taunt the man in the cage, could you at least spare a splash of water… or some other drink? \n\nMy throat is parched, as you might imagine. I can endure the taunts, but not the thirst.
"Why are you in a cage?"

These... fanatical bastards believe anyone else in these ruins is a trespasser.\n\nLast time I checked, no one's had claim to this land for centuries, but they didn't want to hear that. Obsessed with finding some dusty old rock…
"The Word of Water?"

Hm. So you're chasing the legends too? I could help, you know… if you help me.\n\nFind the key to spring me from this cage and I'll give you the secret these ruffians have no hope of learning on their own.
"You'll help me find the keystone?"

Sadly, these rogues already found the keystone. But I'm betting you could liberate it from them. \n\nWhat they don't have is what I offer. Get me out of here, and I'll tell you where to find the chamber the keystone unlocks.
Get the Word of Water and the key to this cage and we'll do business, my friend.
I'll need to rest here. My legs are like iron rods after being in that damn cage!
"You're out of your cage. I've upheld my end of the bargain."
Well done. I would have been tempted to give these brutes some payback, but you seem to have done the job well enough. \n\nI suppose it's now on me to uphold my end of our bargain.
"That's the idea. Now, tell me where the egg chamber is."
I'll tell you, my word on it! But let's get to a safe place first. Out of sight from these thugs... and out of earshot. \n\nThis way - I know a spot just outside the ruins.
Now, I must ask - I've encountered religious fanatics in the ruins before, but you hardly seem the type. Why are you caught up in all this?
"Just hired to find these eggs. That's all."
Hah, now it makes sense! Normally, I'd ask you to cut me in, but that would be an unfair demand under the circumstances.
Tell me this much, though - the people who hired you - they're looking to grind up the eggs for spell components?
Secrets of the Sands
I met a strange desert wanderer named Sharif. He was able to point me to the Word of Water and gave me an idea of where to take it. I should head that way and see if I can find the egg chamber.
"Possibly. Do you have a problem with that?"

No, why should I give a damn about some dried up old eggs? Truthfully, I'm not even sure the chamber's still there. \n\nBut if you do get the egg, I'd suggest you know who you're dealing with, ensure their intentions are… sensible.
"Good advice. Now where's the egg chamber?"

The wastes near the Pools of Orcus, among the geysers. If you get in, there's no guarantee the egg's still intact. \n\nIf it is, however, before you deliver it to your patron, meet me in New Corsica. I might have a better offer.
If you were hired by someone associated with those fanatics, I advise you to consider carefully whether to continue in this enterprise.

Back from the Pools of Orcus, I see? And judging by the look in your eye, I gather you've procured the egg as well. \n\nI don't have an offer of coin to persuade you, but I would appeal to your honor if you would hear me out.
"This had better be good."

I'm in no position to champion any moral code, but this new cult claiming to be the Blood of the Sands - they are mad and dangerous. \n\nYou do realize what type of creature has been incubating in that egg for the last few millennia?
"A massive desert wurm?"

That is correct. And you see the destruction wrought by Shah Neshen, yes? Imagine if there were hundreds of Devourers here. \n\nThis Malek and his cult, that is what they seek, to unleash this destructive force upon Aeternum.
"How do you know this?"

I've no desire to get any more involved - this is not my fight. \n\nI'm simply suggesting you sell the egg to a sorcerer, or crack it open and make yourself a delicious breakfast, but do not give it to these fanatics.
Follow the wild man! Do not surrender the egg!
Follow the wild man! Do not surrender the egg!
I have nothing more to say about those damned eggs. \n\nAfter several days in that cage, I have a quite a thirst to slake - and a dark-eyed beauty to find.
New Corsica is a big city, isn't it? You could get lost just wandering the streets!

It's about time our illustrious leader came by a for a visit! I was starting to worry you'd been eaten by a desert wurm. \n\nThese Blood of the Sands folks are a bit agitated. They say you've been more trouble than help.
"They're not Blood of the Sands."

Hm, I suppose that's not surprising. That Malek fella seems to be hiding something. \n\nI'll just stash the egg near here until we know more. But we should give our client the benefit of the doubt. Professional courtesy.

Before you go all heroic on me and kill the deal, you've got to make sure you have the full story. \n\nI know someone who can help us, a real knowledgable lady I've been eyeing as a recruit for the Silver Crows.

More good news! I've caught wind of another adventurer well-suited to joining the Silver Crows. \n\nBetween you and Zander, we got the brawn. This one, she brings a wealth of knowledge. And not the kind you get from a book!
Voices of the Desert
Grace O'Malley is suggesting I approach a bard named Rima Bahar about joining the Silver Crows.
"A new recruit? Tell me more."

Rima Bahar. She's a minstrel of sorts, performed at taverns across Aeternum for years. \n\nBut she's not just a musician. They say her blade's as quick as her wits. And she's got a network - she knows things.
"Sounds like a solid addition to the team."

My point exactly! You and me are still newcomers, and Zander… well, let's just say he's not exactly a fount of knowledge. \n\nRima's already heard rumors of the Crows, of course, so I took the liberty of sending word you'd pay a visit.
"Where do I find this amazing minstrel?"
She'll be performing at the tavern in New Corsica, as I understand it. \n\nI'd suggest you don't drag your feet. These bard types don't stay in one place for long. Can't let her slip away, can we?
Not only will recruiting Rima give us access to all her knowledge, we might even get to hear a little music and singing at the Crow's Nest!

I’ve met stately, noble gentry, And shipwrecked men of twenty I’ve met souls from ancient memory, found in sagas and dusty tomes I’ve seen ghosts and fiends and horrors, And met knights and bold explorers As I’ve wandered every corner of this island we call home I’ve met kings of earthly nations, Seen the gods of all creations, Tasted wine at every station, from sands to misty moors, But the partings that we weather, And the memories we treasure Are the souls we've Lost forever on Aeternum's forgotten shores
(Instrumental riff)
I’ve met stately, noble gentry, and shipwrecked men of twenty
I’ve met souls from ancient memory, found in sagas and dusty tomes
I’ve seen ghosts and fiends and horrors, and met knights and bold explorers
As I’ve wandered every corner of this island we call home
Let's go!
Keep it together!
Dig in. Hahaha! Woo!
Come on now.
I’ve met kings of earthly nations, seen the gods of all creations
Tasted wine at every station, from sands to misty moors
But the partings that we weather, and the memories we treasure
Are the souls we've Lost forever, on Aeternum's forgotten shores.
New Corsica may be my favorite city in all of Aeternum - the romance, the mystery, the passionate heat of desert nights… it's a lively place.

This is no common wayfarer stopping in for a tankard and a tune! \n\nYour deeds are known to me, Soulwarden, and your more recent incarnation leading the Silver Crows. I've considered composing a song about you.
"A flattering one, I hope."

Hmm, perhaps the intrigue of wondering what I'll write is more valuable than the words themselves. \n\nThat will be especially true if we are to draw blades together and mix the melodies of our fates. That is your intent, yes?
"Yes, we'd like you to join the Silver Crows."

I have no commitment to prevent me from sharing my talents with the Crows, but I will expect compensation, and coin only goes so far. \n\nSee, what I seek is more valuable - it's inspiration whether by story or song.
"It will never be boring. I can promise you that."

Excitement and drama are elements of the equation, but tragedy and passion are vital as well, and… art. \n\nIn fact, at the risk of asking too much, I would request that you prove to me you share my passion for music.
"I can do that. Anything specific?"

As a matter of fact, I do have something in mind - an expression of the desert, a song of humor, strife, and woe. \n\nYou will need to acquire a satyr's flute to use in collecting the laugh of a jackal, the roar of a lion, and the cry of the peacock.
"That's it? Just a song composed of animal cries?"

Ah, but it isn't the song itself. Not exactly. You see, my research in the library has unveiled stories of a sacred lute locked behind the "Voices of the Desert." \n\nI've found the lute, but I need the song. The books are still here, if you want to look for yourself.
"That's no small request."

Well, such is the life of a bard and storyteller. The requests, the praise, and the critique… and the need to spin life's mysteries into song. \n\nCollect the elements I've requested, then meet me near Jupiter's Grove. Good luck.
(The strange jackal seems to stare right at you, as if it is expecting something.)
"Can you understand me?"
"Okay… well… how about a joke?"
"So, why don't dogs like to walk on the sand in Brimstone? Because it's too ruff!"
"No? All right… let's try this. Why don't cats like trees? Because of their bark!"
…\n\nHEEE EEHEHEHEEE!
… eeee heehee… hehe …

string.comment: I tried to get Dog to stay back in New Corsica, but he wasn't having it. \n\nSeems fine out in this heat, though… Maybe better than either of us! Haha!
string.speaker: Zander The Undying
string.name: ZanderTheUndying

resources.string: There are so many ingredients out here that I haven’t seen! This expedition is proving to be quite useful!
“Speaking of ingredients, do you know a recipe to make a lion roar?"
Make a lion roar? Haha, that’s not a request I thought I’d hear. You know I don’t eat meat but hmmm… I might have something in mind for a lion. \n\nHere, try this. That should work for what you want.
Good luck with that recipe. Oh, and don’t eat any of it. A lion might roar… but I’m not sure what would happen to you. Ha ha!
Don't mistake the complexity of my request for hesitation. I am very much interested in teaming up with you and the Silver Crows.

For a moment, I doubted whether you would go through with it, but I am enormously pleased that you did. \n\nIf you have collected what I asked for with the satyr's flute, all that remains now is the music.
"I am ready whenever you are."

Play the song here and we will gauge the magic of it. It should break the seal. \n\nInside is a sacred lute I have dreamt of playing for many years. With it, I will join you and we will compose legendary songs together.
Go on. My ears and my heart yearn to hear your music.

Ah, to rest my eyes on such a legendary instrument! This alone would be adequate compensation for joining the Silver Crows. \n\nThe chance to partner with you and bear witness to your heroic deeds… that is a bonus.
"So you'll join the Silver Crows?"

Yes, I have already spoken with Grace O'Malley, and I will return to her to confirm my commitment. \n\nFirst, however, I must spend some time with this beautiful lute. We will make enchanting music together. I will join you after.
I will meet you back in New Corsica.
I will meet you back at the Silver Crows encampment.

Ah, you've done good, recruiting the most famous bard in all Aeternum. Rima rounds out the team even better than I hoped. \n\nShe seems quite enamored of you as well - I don't think we have to worry that she'll just wander off.

string.comment: these Grace lines should become Grace's quets bestowal
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: Our newest member came in from the desert more than a little inspired, I'd say. \n\nShe was only here a moment and went off to prove her worth - to learn the truth about Malek and his claims on being the Blood of the Sands.
Second Thoughts
Rima has joined the Silver Crows, and is heading back to New Corsica to help us find the other eggs that Malek asked us to collect. I should make my way back there and meet up with her.
"I should probably speak to Malek as well."

Ah yeah, we don't want the Silver Crows to get a reputation for just abandoning our clients. \n\nWait until we hear what Rima's able to dig up first, though. And there's still the question of the other eggs.
"We still might want to find those."

I was afraid you'd say that. I'd ask why bother if there's no coin in it, but I know you're seeing a threat in all this. \n\nIf we're not giving the eggs to Malek, though, what the hell are we going to do with them?
"I know someone who might take them."

Well then, you're the one figuring this all out, you can take this egg back until you decide what to do with it. \n\nAh, and here we are now - it seems Rima's already returned. Ask her what she found out.
Look, I'd say we've done our diligence on this by bringing Rima on board. \n\nIf you think we should break off this business with Malek, I'm with you all the way.

When Grace told me this client was claiming to be Blood of the Sands, I knew right away something was amiss. \n\nIt was a sacred order back in the time of the Ancients, but they haven't been heard from in centuries.
"Did you learn anything else?"

A confirmation of your suspicions, I believe. Apparently, Malek was preaching in the streets after the awakening of Shah Neshen. \n\nHe believes the time of prophesy has arrived - that all the Devourers will soon awaken.
"And he attracted folllowers?"

Yes, though he's hired many unscrupulous mercenaries as well, all under the banner of the Blood of the Sands. \n\nIt was not just the Order's duty to protect the eggs, you see, it was also to hatch them when the time comes.
"So he does intend to hatch the eggs."

Apparently, despite the prophesy he speaks of corresponding to the annihilation of humanity and the end of the world. \n\nThis Malek and his followers, they are the worst kind of mad - the kind that seeks to harm others.
"Then we can't give him the eggs."

That would be a very bad idea. We should find someone to take the egg we've procured and then tell Malek the deal is off. \n\nWe also need to ensure he doesn't get the others. You go on, I'll tell Grace.
This has all the makings of quite a tragic tale, one I'd rather remains nothing but fiction.
XXXX
XXXX
Remember, Heru Plaza. And keep it to yourself… best not to alert others to what we’re planning.
Whatever reason you have for coming back here, it can't be a good one.\n\nI don't want anything to do with your cultish client, that egg, or anything else to do with the damned Blood of the Sands.
"You're not telling me the whole story."

Well, of course I'm not! There's not a soul in this desert who doesn't have secrets!\n\nComing from a family of superstitious fools who liked to say incantations over dusty old eggs, well, that's just one of the more shameful ones.
"You're a descendant of the Blood of the Sands."

Yes, and you'll have to forgive me for not shouting that in the streets. My family was only slightly less mad than this Malek character. \n\nThat's why I walked away from that tradition centuries ago, and never regretted it.
“Why did you turn away from them?"

Because I didn't want to spend centuries alone in hiding with a bunch of eggs!\n\nTo watch them until the day they're ready to hatch…? What a terrible idea! No, they're better just left and forgotten.
"Fine, but you at least have to help me."

Agh! You did me a good turn with that cage situation, so I suppose I owe you, but I'd be doing it as a friend, not a believer.\n\nI guess the question is what to do with the thing if you're not going to give it to Malek.
"Yes, where can we hide it so he doesn't find it?"
I suppose… there is a place I know up north. I'll mark it on your map. \n\nIt's an older repository, abandoned and lost to history. Damn it… fine. I suppose I'll meet you there.
Well, here we are - one of my least favorite places in Brimstone Sands, it's hot, dusty, and treacherous as hell.\n\nNot a drink, nor a dark-eyed beauty in sight… not even much treasure to speak of.
I’m glad this chamber is still here. I thought it might have been lost to the sands.
"But we can hide the egg here?"

Yes. There's a vault. You'll have to clear a path through this rabble, however.\n\nOnce inside, place the egg on the pedestal and we'll seal the chamber door. That should keep it safe from lunatics like Malek.
XXXXXX
XXXXXX
The one place I thought we could avoid the mad cultists and they come flying out of the stonework. \n\nI'll give them credit for their dedication. I guess this means we're being followed, my friend.
Cover your tracks over the dunes. They clearly know how to find us.
"We'll have to hide the egg somewhere else."

I don't know - it was a pretty short list of places I had in mind. We may have to come up with a new plan.\n\nFor now, I'll lead as many as I can out into the dunes, and then I'll circle back and catch up with you.
Well, you've been gone quite some time! Oh, listen to me, I swear I'm starting to sound like my old gran. \n\nSo what happened with Sharif and the egg?
“Malek's followers attacked us and tried to steal the egg."

Well, shite! This is a right mess! The Crows don't need this sort of complication this early in our career. \n\nLook, I believe Malek is trouble, but he's still our client. We've got to talk to him. We have a reputation to uphold.
This whole bloody Malek business is a headache we didn't need. \n\nWe've got to sort this whole mess out.
False Profits

Grace O'Malley is concerned about the reputation of the Silver Crows, especially now that we are backing out on a contract. She has asked that I confront Malek about his role in the ambush in the egg chamber, and see if he can offer an explanation.
“So what now then?"

Like it or not, we still have a responsibility to our client, even if they're under suspicion. \n\nWe're going to have to give Malek a chance to explain his side, and pray that he has a bloody good story.
“So are you going to speak with him?"

Not me! You've been involved since the beginning, and you'll have the best chance to work this out. \n\nI won't know if he's lying or telling the honest truth since all of my information is second hand.
"Grace, he ordered someone to attack me."

I know, it looks bad! But we've got to protect our reputation! We can't have people thinking we back out of deals willy-nilly. \n\nHis camp isn't too far outside of New Corsica, head there and see if you can smooth this out.
Here's hoping this is all just some misunderstanding and we can find a quick solution. \n\nI'd hate for potential clients to second guess our ability to get anything done.
You can't stop our destiny! The Blood of the Sands will control our own fate!
Stop the intruder! Any who oppose us is our enemy!

I've found it! Blood is the key! 

I've found the means to unlocking our liberation - our tool to overcoming this accursed island and the puppeteers that trapped us here! The Blood of the Sands had this power and they squandered it. 

But I will not! Now that I can hatch the eggs of Shah Neshen, they will be at my beck and call. I will control our fate and see these so-called Ancients bow to my will!
Well, don't you look worse for wear? What happened out there?
“I was attacked. Malek has turned on us."
Oh bollocks! Our reputation is going to sink like a bloody stone because of this! \n\nI should've known better than to listen to some zealot!
“Malek means to hatch the eggs."
XXXXXX
XXXXXX
He's hatching those bloody monsters? Blast that bastard to hell! \n\nAnd why are you holding on to one of those damned eggs?
Hatching a clutch of colossal monsters eager to eat everything in their path? \n\nWhat kind of a lunatic would do such a thing?!
Egg Hunt

Now that Grace sees that Malek's plans threaten the whole of Aeternum, she has directed the Silver Crows to actively work against his Blood of the Sands. We need to first find the location of the second egg.
“We need to collect the eggs to keep them from Malek."
Oh so you want to collect more of the bloody things? I swear this desert heat must be getting to all of us… \n\nAlright! Yes, that's the right plan. Where can we find the next egg, then?
“I'll need to see if Rima has found any more information on them."

Right, check with her and see what she can tell you. In the meantime, I'm going to let the Silver Crows know that Malek needs to be stopped at all costs. \n\nI hope we never get another miserable bastard for a client…
Hopefully Rima can get you steered in the right direction. Malek seems a crafty bastard so we need to move quickly.
It's good to see you again. I've managed to find more information on this mural when you're ready to hear it.
“That's what I'm here for. Did you find a second egg?"
Ah yes, well… in a way. Let me explain. \n\nThe locations of the last two eggs are vague, probably intentionally so. They left clues, but the exact locations are unclear.
“I have faith in you, Rima."
Well, thank you. I have in fact managed to find another egg, but I suspect it's not going to be easy. \n\nThis one mentions something about a "Word of Stone."
“Makes sense. The last one was behind the Word of Water."

The mural alludes to the Word of Stone being a beacon for the egg chamber. \n\nThere are also a few confusing words, one of which could mean "sight" or "direction." But I think in this context, it's something like "map."
“So the Word of Stone is a map?"

Well, the way the mural uses these symbols, I'm more inclined to believe the Word of Stone activates or possibly reveals a map. \n\nI believe you need to find the Word of Stone, and then use it to activate a map in a special place.
“Right. Find the Word of Stone, then find a map room."

That seems to be the heart of it, yes. Start your search in Diospolis. From what I can gather, they're using an ancient name for that area. \n\nAnd oh, Zander was looking for you. Sounds like you might have company on your way.
Yes, it is hot here, but try one summer in Greece, and you will know what hot means! \n\nIf Aeternum were in Greece, we would have no Lost, because they would not bother to rise from the dead.
There you are, my friend!\n\nYou look ready to embark on a great adventure.
Have you crossed the desert before? It can be… quite the journey. \n\nI’m just getting some things together, I’ll meet you there shortly.
“Something like that. Are you hoping to join me?"
Of course! Grace sent word for us to help. I would have arrived sooner, but her map was incredibly faulty!\n\nEverything was backwards! Ah wait. It was upside down. That makes so much more sense.
“Glad to have you. Meet me in Diospolis?"
I will! Yes. Where is Diospolis? Never mind, I am joking!\n\nI will pick up a few supplies and meet you there. Sooner or later.

I tried to get Dog to stay in New Corsica, but he was not happy about that.\n\nYes I know, Dog, you have a sensitive nose and don't like big settlements! Yes I said that just now, did you not hear me? What “way” did I say it?
Don’t spare us a thought. Dog and I can take care of ourselves.
[Dog gives you a slow blink.]
[Dog 's ears are perked up, as if he is listening intently to something nearby.]
“Glad to have you here. What's your plan?"
Grace told me you were ambushed before, so Dog and I will keep that from happening again. \n\nWe will guard the entrance here, and make sure that nobody follows you in.
“Sounds good. I'll return once I find the egg chamber."
We will keep a careful watch for you. \n\nBe safe in there, my friend!
Welcome back! As you can see, we had some uninvited guests. So, Dog and I... uninvited them. It seems someone is very interested in your search. \n\nBut how was it? Did you find the egg chamber?
“I did. It's out in the ruins to the east."
Excellent! I am enjoying this adventure with you, except for all of this miserable sand!\n\nIf one more tiny rock finds its way into my loincloth, I will scream. Ah. AHHHH!
So another trip across the desert for us, is it? You know, I have changed my mind, Brimstone is hotter than Greece!\n\nPut a chicken and some milk in a bag, and opa! Avgolemono Soup.
Precarious Position

After using the Word of Stone on a strange map in Diospolis. I've found the location of a second egg chamber. I should head out to the Place of Pillars and see if I can locate the door to the chamber.
“We need to move quickly. Malek's loyalists might know where the egg is."
Yes, of course! Dog and I will meet you there- he has gone hunting. \n\nI do not know what he is hoping to catch out here, other than scorpions and more of these- tiny rocks. AHHHH!

If you find any spare eggs in there, I would like to try cooking one. In ancient times, they believed Devourer eggs had magical properties.\n\nDon't you wonder what a Devourer egg tastes like? Not sand, I hope.
So, this is the Place of Pillars? I wonder why they call it that.\n\nAh, what are we doing here, again?
“According to the map, another egg room should be here."
I see. Then it's just a matter of finding the door? \n\nHmm, what kind of door would it be? Something shaped like the one up there?
"What? Zander, that's it!"
Ah. Something that looks like that door, then? \n\nThe way the walls are constructed, it seems there was an upper level before. Perhaps-
"No, Zander, that door, that must be it!"
Haha! Good. Well. I am not much for climbing, so I will leave it to you. \n\nBut don't worry, my friend, if anyone tries to follow you, we will crack them. Like an egg.
So, this is the Place of Pillars? I wonder why they call it that.\n\nAh, what are we doing here, again?
[Dog looks up at you contently. He doesn't seem the least bit bothered by the heat.]
Well, I could say it was a coincidence bumping into you like this, but I think we both know it's not.\n\nI'm just glad that I didn't climb all the way up here for nothing.
"I'm glad you're here. I could use your help."

If I had a coin for every time I heard that… well, I wouldn't be all that wealthy. \n\nIn fact, if I'm being honest, after we parted last, I strongly considered taking a couple weeks to tour the taverns of southern Aeternum.
The wild man has come! Find him! Find the wild man!
The wild man has come! Find him! Find the wild man!
But then I thought of you, my friend, working dilligently to collect these eggs for the good of Aeternum... \n\nI realized you were shouldering someone else's responsibility... my responsibility.
XXXXXXX
Heir to the Sands

After finding the second egg in the Place of Pillars, I ran across Sharif Sahar once again… or rather, he ran across me. It seems he is actively searching for the eggs himself, and might know how to find the third egg. I should follow him to the ancient Blood of the Sands Temple.
"Alright, then let's find that third egg."

Fortunately, I have a pretty good idea of where we might find it.\n\nThe Blood of the Sands had a temple dedicated to their practices. It's where we trained members of our order and performed our sacred rituals, but it's also where many of our secrets were held.
“You think the location of the third egg might be there?"

I do. My father was the Speaker of the Devourer before I was meant to take the mantle. He's the one who carved the murals you've found out in the sands. \n\nHe would've kept the location of that third egg close to him and the order.
“It sounds like a good place to start."

Indeed. Let me mark the location on your map. We should split up again in case Malek is still tracking us. \n\nI'll wait for you outside the entrance to the Temple. Do not tarry - we don't know what Malek's next move might be.
I haven't been to that temple in… a very long time. I face this journey with no small amount of trepidation.
There you are! I was afraid you may have gotten stuck, looking for a way down.\n\nThat happened to Dog once, though he won't admit it- yes, you did! So, were you able to find the egg?
Truth be told, I didn’t pack enough for this trip. But I’ve found that the desert is more bountiful than I imagined. Think of all the new recipes!
To think that an old temple once stood here. What a mystery! \n\nBut that is Brimstone. This desert has centuries of secrets buried under its rocks and dunes.
[Dog rolls over on his back briefly. It's probably a trap.]
“I did. But now we need to find the third."
Pythagoras believed that the number three carries great power.\n\nI have a feeling there is something fateful about this third egg. Where will we find it?
“It's an old temple south of here. Let me show you…"
Yes, I see. Dog and I will meet you there. Travel safely, my friend. \n\nYes, Dog, I know you have sand in your fur, complain one more time and I will shave you! Who are you calling bald?
Gone! They have been taken! Gone!
Gone! They have been taken! Gone!
Hello again, friend. Welcome to the sacred temple of the Blood of the Sands. What's left of it, anyway.
“Have you been inside yet?"
I have not. As you might imagine, I'm a bit hesitant about stepping back into that old life. The memories of that time are… uh, not pleasant.
"Hopefully we can make this quick and be on our way."
Agreed. Let's search the temple for clues, and see if we can't find that third egg. \n\nJust give me a moment to collect myself before I head down. I'll meet you inside.
I'll be there in a few minutes. Just let me gather my thoughts.
Ah, my head… give me a moment…
“What happened? You seemed fine outside."
It's nothing. Just every so often I get some strange… flashes. Nothing to worry about - it'll pass.
“Flashes? Sharif, can you hear the voice, too?"
Wait… you can hear that? The voice of the Devourer? \n\nIncredible! I thought only a member of our bloodline could hear them speak. But they've somehow reached out to you.
“It's spoken to me a few times."
Well, that's a mystery that will have to wait. I have some news. \n\nThis mural - it's not something I've seen before. It must have been carved after I left the order.
“Does it show the location of the third egg?"
It does, but it also shows something else. \n\nThe order hid a clutch of eggs here, in the temple. Though it's so strange though… that never happened while I lived here.
“There's an entire clutch here?"
I'll explain later. Let's collect these eggs and get out of here. \n\nCheck in the reliquary, and I'll check the rest of the Temple. Meet me outside when you find them!
Tell me you found the eggs! So much depends on this!
Did you find them? Do you have the eggs?
“The eggs were gone. A small Devourer attacked me!"
It's as I feared! Someone took the eggs… and I have a guess as to who.
“Malek? But how did he know about this place?"

I believe he found this temple, dicovered the existence of the Blood of the Sands, and the Royal Eggs, then built this new order around that discovery. \n\nIt's like I said, he's a madman using the name of the order to gain power.
“What do you mean, 'Royal' egg?"

So these eggs that Malek sent the Silver Crows to find? They are extremely rare. \n\nThe Blood of the Sands called them 'Royal' because they hatch the gargantuan Devourers that prowl beneath the dunes.
“So what were the ones here, then?"

They were drone eggs - a smaller breed of Devourer like the one you faced. They support the Royals in the manner of worker ants supporting their queens. \n\nBut Malek having the drone eggs means he's trying to raise an army, not just control a single Royal.
It seems Malek is continually a step ahead of us. This just keeps getting worse.
Empty Nest

It seems Malek found the Blood of the Sands Temple some time ago, and is using the knowledge he discovered within to collect the Devourer eggs, including Royal eggs that hatch the gargantuan beasts that prowl the dunes. Worse, he seems to have a clutch of drone eggs as well, and is potentially raising an army of the creatures. Sharif says we need to find these eggs, and potentially destroy them.
“We discovered that Malek found the means to hatch the eggs."
Oh, god be good! This just keeps getting worse! \n\nIf he can hatch the eggs, we might not have a choice but to destroy them to keep him from doing that.
“But you said the Devourers might retaliate."
I did. And they might. But having them under the control of someone like Malek? That could be far worse. \n\nAnd once the process has started, it cannot be stopped. I… need to prepare for that.
“And we need the third egg."
There's a set of ruins north of the Great Pyramid, once a Blood of the Sands ritual site. The third egg chamber is there. I'll mark it on your map. \n\nHopefully we're not too late.
Watch yourself. We're in a direct race with Malek, and I'm sure he knows that by now. \n\nHis cultists are likely all over the desert looking for us.
I’m beginning to think there are as many sets of ruins as there are grains of sand out here.
[Dog seems to be interested in some nearby sounds. His ears are moving quickly.]
We're here… but it looks like Malek and his followers are as well.
“We must get the egg before they do."

That we must. I believe I have a plan. \n\nDo you think you could create a diversion so I could sneak inside and find the egg? If you make enough noise, they should be distracted long enough so I can make off with it.
“Oh I'm good with diversions."
Excellent! Fight your way toward the egg chamber. By the time you make it there, I should have the egg. Then we can escape together. \n\nBest of luck, my friend! I'll see you inside!
Malek said you might come for the egg! Too late, blasphemer! It belongs to us now!
I'm so glad I found you here! Where's Sharif?
“He should be here. He was looking for the egg."
We need to find him quickly! We cannot let Malek get his hands on him!
“Wait, why? What's going on?"
Remember when you found that note Malek wrote about hatching the eggs? 'Blood is the key' and all of that? \n\nIt means the Blood of the Sands. The blood of the heir. Sharif's blood!
Taken! He has been taken! Blood is the key!
Taken! He has been taken! Blood is the key!
I cannot believe I didn't see it earlier! We cannot let Malek get Sharif's blood!
I cannot imagine what will become of Brimstone - of ALL of Aeternum - if Malek hatches those eggs!
[Dog's eyes are wide as he watches the area around him.]
Break Some Eggs
Sharif has been taken by Malek's followers, who are seeking to use his blood to hatch the eggs of the Devourers. I need to find Sharif and try to put a stop to Malek's plans.
“They couldn't have gotten too far."
Then we need to move quickly. I'm sure Sharif would've put up a struggle. \n\nLook for some tracks and see if you can't find where they took him.
I cannot imagine what will become of Brimstone - of ALL of Aeternum - if Malek hatches those eggs!
I need to keep my wits about me. I shouldn’t have let Sharif get taken in the first place.

string.comment: Badly wounded, drained of blood, lucky to be alive.
string.speaker: Sharif Shara
string.name: SharifShara

resources.string: My… friend… My plan was not... as successful as I had originally hoped…
“Sharif! Thank goodness you're alive! What happened?"
I was looking for the egg chamber… someone snuck up on me, stealthy bastard… gave me quite a blow to the head. \n\nI remember being dragged... through the sands until I ended up here.
“Did they get any of your blood?"
Any? I think they took it all... more than once… but I can't be sure… it's all a blur... \n\nThis accursed island wouldn't let death take me. I was at their mercy…
“With your blood, they can hatch the eggs."
Then you must listen to me. If Malek has awakened those eggs, they are corrupted. \n\nYou can't let them hatch! No matter what! We need to… we have to…
“I understand. What must I do?"

You can't just kick the egg and break it. You'll need to coat your weapon with a special oil that will help the weapon crack the shell. Here's the recipe for it. \n\nYou'll need to collect the ingredients and make the oil.
“And where am I going once I have the oil?"

There's a temple near New Corsica, in Neopolis. The Blood of the Sands used to keep eggs there to prepare them for hatching. \n\nI overheard his followers mention a "hatchery" - I believe that's where Malek is going.
My friend, you've a grim look about you. Speak to me.
“I fought Malek's followers. I had no choice but to--"
--Destroy the eggs. I know. I could feel it. \n\nI wish there had been a way to save them. But it was this or risk an army of violent Devourers under Malek's control.
So tell me, friend. What happened down there? Is it done?
Legacy of the Sands
I was able to destroy the corrupted eggs in Malek's possession, but Malek himself has escaped. It's time to confront him and put an end to his plans.
“Malek escaped. We need to find him."
The complex beneath us is huge - or it used to be. \n\nOur Speakers used to commune with the Devourers here before presenting them the eggs. It's the role I was being prepared for.
“I'll find Malek there and put a stop to this."
Look under the ruins of Satet. I believe there is a way to the sanctum through there. \n\nMay you walk the path to heaven, my friend.
I feel I am to blame. If I hadn't walked away from my calling as Speaker for the Blood of the Sands, Malek could never have done any of this.
We’ll keep watch up here. Malek seems to have many more followers than we realized.
You go. I'll keep an eye on Sharif and keep Malek's followers off of him.
I can't believe it is done. But what an awful way to go. Especially in a place like this.
Don’t worry about me, friend. I’ll make it to New Corsica just fine. Especially with Rima’s help.
You think you've won? I will put an end to you and that heretic Sharif!
Your own eyes deceive you! I will cut you down where you stand!
Feel the fury of the burning sands!
You cannot escape from me! The very desert is my ally!
Ha! Try again, fool!
ARGH! How did you… ?

string.comment: igc - last part is Malek screaming as he's eaten by the Sandworm
string.speaker: Malek
string.name: Malek

resources.string: We had a destiny! The Devourers should be ours to control! I will destroy all who stand against me! Ah! Ahh! Ahhh!
We had a destiny!
The Devourers should be ours to control!
I will destroy all who stand against me!
Ah! Ahh! Ahhhh!
Is it done? I thought I saw... Shah Neshen!
“It's finished. Malek is gone."

I can't imagine the horror. But the Devourers exact their own justice. They knew who was responsible for the destruction of the eggs. \n\nMalek's fate was sealed the moment he entered the Chamber of Shah Neshen.
“Let's get you back to New Corsica."
Ah, yes! New Corsica, the Jewel of the Brimstone Sands. Fine vintages and great beauty await me there. \n\nThank you, my friend. I shall raise a glass in your honor.
So we felt some rumbling and shaking here in the city. Tell me that wasn't you. \n\nOr better still, tell me that it was! What's the story?
“I faced Malek and put him down."
I still can't believe we had to turn on a client. When word of this gets out…
“That the Crows won't tolerate betrayal?"
Hang on, I didn't consider it that way. Come to think of it, that's pretty damn good! \n\nAll right then, I think we've done all that we can here. Time to wrap things up and move on.
I’ll be glad to get back to the camp. This has been… quite the adventure, wouldn’t you say?
Remembrance
Malek is defeated, and the corrupted eggs are gone. I should check in with my allies and see how they are doing.
“Are we regrouping back at the Silver Crows camp?"
That's the plan. I sent Zander up ahead with our things, but we should check in with Rima and make sure she's ready to go. \n\nWould you mind seeing if she needs anything?
Let me know when you've checked in with everyone. I should be ready to leave by then.
It's good to see you, I'm glad to find you well.
“I'm glad it's over. How's Sharif?"
He had an epiphany of sorts. I have a feeling that our adventure together made him yearn for a life he thought he had left behind. \n\nHe seems like a new man.
“What do you mean?"
It's probably best if you speak to him about that. \n\nI should make my way to meet with Grace. I'm looking forward to seeing the camp!
Sharif isn't far. You should go talk to him.
This was quite the adventure, wasn't it? I can't wait to see what other trouble the Silver Crows can get into.
Ah, here you are, my friend. I had a feeling you might come looking for me once more.
“You're looking much better, Sharif!"
Thanks to you. And I've always been a fast healer. \n\nBut mostly I think a massive weight has been lifted off my shoulders.
“You do seem lighter in your step."

string.comment: Sharif gets melancholy in the second half, wistful.
string.speaker: Sharif Shara
string.name: SharifShara

resources.string: Hah! All thanks to you! \n\nI've avoided my role as Speaker for the Devourer for so long. What happened here was something the Blood of the Sands sought to prevent. I'm surprised it didn't happen sooner.
“So what's your plan?"

To take up the mantle I was born to accept. Some part of it anyway - I'm still not sure I want to lead the Blood of the Sands. \n\nBut I can carry out my duty to protect the eggs of Shah Neshen, and fulfil the promises of my ancestors.
“Best of luck to you, Sharif. Stay safe out there."
And to you as well, my friend. I am certain our journeys will cross once again.
You are the Speaker. Do not abandon your calling again.
You are the Speaker. Do not abandon your calling again.
There are more eggs out there. Finding them will not be easy, but it is a duty I am determined to carry out.
Well? Did you find her? Is she ready to be going?
"Yes, everything we need to do here is finished."
That's what I wanted to hear! \n\nI know we did good work out here, but I've had my fill of the desert and its monsters. I'll be glad to get back to camp.
"Safe journey back. I'll see you there soon."
Take your time, mate. I know you've always got your hands full with one thing or another. I'll let you know when the Silver Crows need you again. \n\nUntil then, safe travels!
Take your time getting back to the camp. I know you always have a wind in your sails. I’ll let you know if the Silver Crows need you!
Excuse me, I am trying to make sure I brought all of my materials. So I have papyrus, my pen, and my journals. \n\nInk? Did I bring ink? By Hephesteus' beard I better not have dropped it…
You! Oh, you there! Can you spare me a moment, please?
Rise of the Beast

I met a historian by the name of Phaedra Kanelos, who fancies herself something of a poet. She is looking to write the next great epic like her hero Homer, and is hoping that by defeating the Devourer, I will become a hero not unlike those in her favorite stories.
“Can I help you?"

It's what I can do to help you! Forgive me, I am getting ahead of myself. My name is Phaedra Kanelos, and I have been cataloguing the exploits of many a hero on this island. \n\nYou've been mentioned in more than one account of herosim, and I've finally found you!
“How do you know who I am?"
Oh now, no need for the modesty. \n\nI had heard you were making your way into Brimstone, so I rushed right over here to try and find you. And I have! Oh, this is so exciting!
“So how is it you can help me?"

Well, you see, I am a poet, and I'm looking to write the next epic. I've always loved the Odyssey, and Homer is something of a hero of mine. \n\nI long to write Aeternum's Odyssey - the great epic for this strange island.
“What does this have to do with me?"

I've heard of a beast of immesurable size that prowls the sands. Something so huge that even the mighty Heracles himself would hesitate to face it. \n\nBut you, my grand hero, I think YOU can slay it!
“The Devourer? You want me to kill a Devourer?"

The Devourer! Oh yes, yes! That's the one! \n\nI've heard there is a group looking to summon one for their own nefarious plans. If you can put a stop to their plans, you would more than earn your place among the greatest names in history!
Remember, when you slay the beast, come right back to me. Don't spare any detail!
Oh, please tell me you've defeated the creature! This is so exciting!
"I did. I managed to defeat one of the Devourers."

Excellent! Oh, I can't wait to hear the tale! Oh we're going to be so famous, you and I! \n\nNow let me start on the introduction - it's important to make the hero seem relatable, someone the reader would like to call a friend…
The wording needs to evoke emotion, stir the imagination, and seize the reader's attention. \n\nI'll read this a thousand times if I have to just to get it right!
Rise of the Hero
Phaedra is still writing her epic, and wants to collect more notes to really make her story stand out. She has asked that I once again confront a Devourer and bring her the tales of my fight with it.
“Did you need something more?"
Well, not to be TOO particular, but I think the story is... How should I put this… still a bit thin? \n\nI need more details! Something more that the reader can really sink their teeth into.
“Defeating a monsterous sand creature wasn't enough?"

Don't think I do not appreciate the epic scale of the feat you've accomplished. It's not something just anyone could have done! \n\nBut the poem calls for more. It needs to drown the reader with the enormity of the tale, barely letting them come up for breath!
“So what are you proposing?"

Another fight against the beast should give us what we need! And we're in luck as I have heard the villains from before have returned and are seeking to summon the creature once again! \n\nThis is our chance! Both to save Brimstone and to get more tales for my... erm, OUR epic!
When you slay the beast, remember, come right back to me. Don't spare any detail!
Have you done it? Have you accomplished the impossible once again?
"The Devourer has been defeated once more."

Oh wonderful! Now I just need to get all of these details down so I don't leave anything out. This tale is going to spread all across Aeternum, and one day, maybe even beyond! \n\nThank you again for all of this! I'll let you know if there's more I need!

string.comment: These camp lines are meant to be transitional in the rare event a player goes to the Crow's Nest and clicks on the character during the quest chain
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: What do you think so far? Brimstone has a touch of mystery to it, doesn't it? \n\nI've always thought of myself more as the practical type, but there's something downright romantic about the desert.

string.comment: These camp lines are meant to be transitional in the rare event a player goes to the Crow's Nest and clicks on the character during the quest chain
string.speaker: Zander The Undying
string.name: ZanderTheUndying

resources.string: I just came back to pick up some spices. What would go well with Devourer eggs?\n\nI am kidding with you! More or less.

string.comment: These camp lines are meant to be transitional in the rare event a player goes to the Crow's Nest and clicks on the character during the quest chain
string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar

resources.string: I've spent time in so many different places, but I always ended up back in Brimstone. \n\nSome places- you know it's home as soon as you get there. And now, I feel my home is with the Silver Crows. And you.

string.comment: These camp lines used after finishing the quest
string.speaker: Grace O'Malley
string.name: GraceOMalley

resources.string: Rima's a great addition to our team- she's a sharp one, and much more than meets the eye.\n\nI'll wager she'll be running the operation end of things around here before long!

string.comment: These camp lines used after finishing the quest
string.speaker: Zander The Undying
string.name: ZanderTheUndying

resources.string: I still cannot believe we haven't gotten a chance for you to try my lemon cakes!\n\nI'm telling you, once I get a proper oven and I bake them for you, you are going to beg me to make them every day!

string.comment: These camp lines used after finishing the quest
string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar

resources.string: We really need to help Grace with the camp construction. Well, it's homey? \n\nBut it looks like a pirate gathered bits of shipwreck and strung it together with rope and sailcloth.
Five Second Temp Timer
Collect a rubbing of the Ancient Mural
Bring the mural rubbing to meet the new client Malek in New Corsica
Talk to the sage Sadiki Masufa in the inn of New Corsica
Travel to the Great Bazaar to look for translation objects
Search for Faded Coins
Find a Market Tablet
Return to New Corsica with the items
Travel out to Digsite Calamitous to find the Word of Water
Search the Digsite tents for clues
Speak with the caged stranger
Defeat Sand Raiders to find a key to Sharif's cage
Speak with Sharif, now free of his cage
Follow Sharif out of the Digsite
Unlock Sharif's cage
Collect the Word of Water keystone
Find the geysers near the Pools of Orcus that Sharif mentioned
Find a way to open the Chamber Door using the Word of Water
Carry a rock
Place rocks to block the 3 geysers
Place the Word of Water
Enter the Egg Chamber
Defeat the Guardians of the egg chamber
Take the Mysterious Egg
Leave the egg chamber
Meet Sharif in New Corsica before returning the egg
Report your success to the bandit Sharif
Look for Rima Bahar in the tavern of New Corsica
Meet Rima Bahar in the New Corsica tavern
Go to the Bubasteum to find the Satyr's Flute
Search the library of New Corsica For Clues
Find a clue about the Satyr Flute
Find a clue about the Peacock Song
Find a clue about the Jackal Song
Take the Satyr Flute
Talk to Zander about a recipe for lion food
Collect Spices for Lion Food
Collect Fatty Meat from Jackals in Brimstone
Craft Zander's Lion Treat at a kitchen or in your camp
Go to the Temple of Shu
Place Zander's Lion Treat
Collect the lion's roar
Go to the Ruined Seret to find the peacocks
Collect Peacock Feathers
Place the Peacock Feathers
Collect the peacock's cry
Search near Henkhisesui for the Strange Jackal
Find the Strange Jackal
Collect the jackal's laugh
Craft the Voices of the Desert Song at a workshop or at your camp
Go to Jupiter's Grove to meet with Rima Bahar
Talk to Rima Bahar in Jupiter's Grove
Play the Voices of the Desert on the Satyr Flute
Collect the Lute of Phoebus
Give Rima the Lute of Phoebus
Return to New Corsica
Speak to Rima Bahar
Speak to Sharif
Travel to Heru Plaza
Speak to Sharif near Heru Plaza
Clear out Heru Plaza
Enter the Egg Repository
Place the Mysterious Egg
Defeat the assassin ambush
Speak to Sharif about the ambush
Return to New Corsica
Find Malek's camp
Defeat Malek's guards
Confront Malek
Search for evidence of Malek's plans
Return to New Corsica to report
Speak to Rima Bahar
Speak to Zander the Undying
Travel to Diospolis
Speak to Zander the Undying in Diospolis
Collect the Word of Stone from the {targetName}
Search the {targetName} for a way to activate the ancient map
Unlock the Map Room Door
Search the ancient map room
Place the Word of Stone
Search For the second egg chamber
Travel to the Place of Pillars
Speak to Zander the Undying
Find the ancient egg chamber door
Enter the ancient egg chamber
Explore the ancient egg chamber
Defeat Surahkdot the Ever Watchful
Take the mysterious egg
Return to Zander the Undying
Speak to Sharif
Speak to Zander the Undying
Go to the Temple of the Sands in Brimstone
Speak to Sharif
Enter the Temple of the Sands
Find Sharif in the Temple of the Sands
Clear the temple invaders to enter the chamber
Defeat {targetName}
Enter the drone egg chamber
Defeat the Enraged Devourer Drone
Inspect the drone egg remains
Return to Sharif outside the temple
Find the last egg chamber in the north
Speak to Sharif
Look for a way into the egg chamber
Search the ancient egg chamber
Defeat Lieutenant Herikai
Return to Sharif outside
Follow the tracks to Sharif
Defeat the guards surrounding Sharif
Find Sharif in the ruins
Find signs of Sharif in the ruins
Follow the tracks to Sharif
Examine Sharif's tracks
Talk to Sharif
Collect the Fireblood Oil Ingredients from anywhere in Brimstone
Collect Dragon Bile from Brimstone Hellmouths
Collect Acidic Resin from any Corrupted
Collect Red Quicksilver from Ancients
Craft the Fireblood Oil
Travel to Neopolis
Use the Fireblood Oil
Enter the Ancient Hatchery
Defeat the Flamecaller
Destroy the corrupted devourer eggs
Destroy the Awakened Eggs of the Devourers
Return to Sharif
Travel to Satet
